title.native: ブラック★★ロックシューター DAWN FALL

description:
The year is 2062. Earth has been left in ruin after the failure of a labor automation project when the AI called Artemis waged war against humanity. A girl, Empress, awakens in a research lab. As one of the three surviving guardians, she must destroy the Orbital Elevator before Artemis can complete its construction. Failure will result in a machine army overrunning Earth. However, Artemis' Unmanned Forces and a cult may have motives of their own.

(Source: Disney+)
hashtag: #ブラックロックシューター #BRS #BRSDF

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Tanks
tags.description: Prominently features the use of tanks or other armoured vehicles.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Vocal Synth
tags.description: Features one or more singers or characters that are products of a synthesize singing program. Popular examples are Vocaloids, UTAUloids, and CeVIOs.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Estranged Family
tags.description: At least one family member of the MC intentionally distances themselves or a family distances themselves from a person related to the MC.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

name.native: ブラック★ロックシューター
alternative: ブラックロックシューター

node.description:
__[Blog](http://huke.blog.shinobi.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hukeweb) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/ryoheihuke) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=9794) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ryoheihuke/)__

huke is a Japanese illustrator who is best known for creating the original character [Black★Rock Shooter](https://anilist.co/character/19706) and working with the Japanese music group [supercell](https://anilist.co/staff/103913). His career as a professional illustrator began when he was involved as a character designer at a game company. He eventually resigned and became freelance, creating original concepts from his experience as a professional. huke soon became involved in certain illustrations based on the game Metal Gear Solid, and to enable and identify himself over the internet, he registered on Pixiv and created a personal blog. On December 2007, he submitted an illustration of Black★Rock Shooter. This inspired [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941), the leader of supercell, and a song became the product of the band's first contact with Black★Rock Shooter. Aside from Black★Rock Shooter, huke also worked on the visual novel Steins;Gate, which was produced by [5pb.](https://anilist.co/staff/109749) and [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/staff/99960). He also designed Hololive EN 1st Gen VTuber, [Takanashi Kiara](https://anilist.co/staff/206030/Kiara-Takanashi).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tensho_tw) | [Website](http://tenshohp.web.fc2.com/)

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

[Website](https://zaqzaqzaq.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zaxic_r) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/zaq39/)

ZAQ began to learn the piano at age three. During her college years, her idol was Minori Chihara, and it was during this time she decided to become a singer. However, she failed all her auditions. In junior high school, her favorite bands were Mongol800 and Going Steady, two rock groups which she was addicted to. Self-taught, her composing and works were characterized by a unique style which is unrestricted by music theory and musicology.

Trivia: She is the tallest of all of the Aqours actresses On December 28, 2024, she officially announced on her social media that she married someone of Indian descent, being the first in her group to be officially married. [Website](https://takatsukikanako.com) | [Profile (Amuse)](https://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/takatsuki_kanako/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kanako_tktk?) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanako.tktk/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMlThy0EvSm7O0FhsUwk61Q)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/momocashew)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/momocashew/)__

Cassie Wei is a Chinese-Canadian vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of [Mili](https://anilist.co/staff/129398/Mili).

[Instagram](https://Instagram.com/yurichessman_nkfs/)

Yuri Chessman da Costa Bomfim, better known as Yuri Chesman, is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director, he is also the son of voice actor [Renato Márcio](https://anilist.co/staff/199776/).

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

__Age:__ 16 __Height:__ 158 cm (5'2")
The first Japanese VOCALOID to be both developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc.. She was initially released in August 2007 for the VOCALOID2 engine and was the first member of the Character Vocal Series, as well as the seventh VOCALOID overall and the second VOCALOID2 vocal released to be released for the engine. Her voice is provided by the Japanese voice actress [Saki Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/95504/Saki-Fujita). There have since been numerous installments, such as additional voice libraries dubbed 'Append', as well as an upgrade for the VOCALOID3 engine, which contained an English vocal release. She received a VOCALOID4 update to her Japanese and English voicebanks in August 2016, as well as a Mandarin Chinese voicebank in September 2017. Miku is considered the most popular and well known Vocaloid and the first to become a pop idol. The name of the title and the character of the software were chosen by combining Hatsu (初, first), Ne (音, sound), and Miku (未来, future) thus meaning "the first sound from the future." Her name was based on her concept of that when a sound is first spoken. When KEI illustrated Miku, he was given a color scheme to work with (based on the YAMAHA synthesizers' signature blue-green colour) and was asked to draw Miku as an android. Crypton also provided KEI with Miku's detailed concepts, however, Crypton said it was not easy to explain what a "Vocaloid" was to him. KEI said he could not create an image of a "singing computer" at first, as he did not even know what a "synthesizer" was. It took him more than a month to complete the commission.

supercell is a Japanese creator group made up of 11 people.

__Members:__
• [ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109941) - music, lyrics, leader, founder
• [Shirow Miwa](https://anilist.co/staff/97974) (三輪士郎) - illustration
• [huke](https://anilist.co/staff/105145) - illustration
• [redjuice](https://anilist.co/staff/107587) - illustration
• Suga (スガ) - illustration
• Maque (マクー) - illustration and animation
• [Yoshiki Usa](https://anilist.co/staff/150014) (宇佐義大) - design
• Hei8ro (丙8郎) - support in illustration and photography
• guitar - support in illustration
• crow - support
• golv - support

__Vocalists:__
• [Nagi Yanagi](https://anilist.co/staff/109637) "nagi" (2009 - 2011)
• Koeda (2011- present)
• [chelly](https://anilist.co/staff/147835) "EGOIST" (2011 - present)
• Ann (guest vocalist)
• gaku (guest vocalist)

__Past Members:__
• 119 (ひけし) - illustration

[Twitter](https://x.com/uta_age8)

Chief of the Art Department at [Andraft](https://anilist.co/studio/7483/Andraft).

Affiliated with [Bibury Animation Studios](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/Bibury-Animation-Studios).
